sub_title: Oil&Gas Expert - Operations, Maintenance,  CSU, Design, Operations Readiness, Troubleshooting, Production Optimization

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

profile_positions.description: Commissioning Manager for McDermott the Hague office, global role EMEA/Eastern Hemisphere Projects. Handled diverse projects, FPU, Steam Cracker, several petrochemical projects. CSU task force leader for a green steel project. Several renewable energy projects (wind, H2).
profile_positions.title: CSU Manager

profile_positions.description: Working as O&M, CSU manager in the Fluor Project Management Team for the SOCAR Gas to Plastics project, a petrochemical complex to be built in Azerbaijan. The project has gas processing, steam cracking, polyethylene, butene-1 and hexene-1 production and supporting utilities.  In addition support brand new Socar Polymers (HDPE and Polypropylene production) Facility. Carried out a start-up review on at the Bayernoil Vohburg Refinery, to evaluate a safe restart after an explosion in Sept. 2018 at this facility.
profile_positions.title: OR, CSU Manager

profile_positions.description: Provide operations, maintenance input in projects. Design and lead CSU exercises. Provide support to operating assets. Troubleshooting of production and maintenance problems. Flawless Project Delivery set up and execution. Business type of support to projects/assets (OPEX, planning). Close out Abadi FLNG project. Assist a bid for Middle East petrochemicals project.
profile_positions.title: Senior OR&A manager

profile_positions.description:
Abadi FLNG project, OR&A team lead. Abadi FLNG shelved until situation with Plan of Development /Indonesian Government sorted out.

Activities were full range of support for LNG operations/maintenance input for FLNG concept. Design of CSU exercise including subsea. Run Flawless Project Delivery program. Write SoW + BoD (OR&A sections) for FEED. Delivery of key documents (O&M philosophies, CSU plan), management of change.
profile_positions.title: Abadi Floating LNG FEED ORA Lead

profile_positions.description:
Operations Readiness & Assurance Manager for Al Karaana Petrochemicals project in Qatar, a project by QP and SHELL. 

Role is to ensure that the project is safely and effectively commissioned and handed over to a fully prepared Manufacturing Organisation that is ready to receive, start-up and operate the assets in a safe, predictable and reliable manner.

Ensure flawless start up (run FPD program). Plan, schedule andexecute commissioning and start up. Design, recruit, prepare and train & competency assure the O&M organization. Support FID activities, define OPEX. Write SoW for EPC ITT's, clarification exercise during tender phase, evaluate EPC bids.

Run a separate Computerized Maintenance Management Contract, define SoW, tender plan, tender clarifications and bid evaluation.
profile_positions.title: OR&A manager QP SHELL Al KAraana Petrochemicals Project

profile_positions.description: Operations/maintenance/technical input into FEED/concept for compression centre CC01, Kashagan FFD. Leading team of 4,5 engineers. SDK member JV SIMOPS working group for Caspian Sea PSA. Member SDK FPD and CC01 LT's. Driving unmanned operations compression centres, team member concept improvement team for FFD, OPEX modelling, review by and obtain approval by JV partners for OPEX/operations concepts. Develop unmanned O&M design philosophy, O&M strategies/philosophies, marine logistics strategy. Lead flawless project delivery, commissioning & start up workstreams for CC01. RAM modelling.
profile_positions.title: OR&A FEED Team Leader Kashagan FFD operations

profile_positions.description:
Technical Support Team Leader Gas Directorate. Dimensions 4 major gas plants (total capacity 100 Nm3/day, 100 kbbl/day condensate), number of satellite fields, extensive pipeline network, 150+ HPHT wells.
Scope: process trouble shooting, process optimization, OR&A input into Gas Directorate projects (most important Saih RAwl wellhead compression projects), CSU, team of 10 people with commissioning contractor forces depending on projects). Life Cycle and Business Planning for all Gas Directorate assets and projects, OPEX, RAM, ADP and BP input.
Specific project dealing with H2S production Kauther Gas Plant.

Lead/steer CSU activities Kauther Gas plant.

Auditing (Egypt)
profile_positions.title: Production Operations Support Team Leader Gas Directorate

profile_positions.description:
Define commisioning strategies and manage commisioning activities (mercury removal project, 20 MMSm3/day gas plant, 48" pipeline, multiple EM and GT driven compression projects, foundation field bus system)
Human Factor Engineering
Project review and concept work, write control narratives, safeguarding memoranda
profile_positions.title: Head Commissioning & Operations Liaison

profile_positions.description:
Define commisioning strategies and manage commisioning activities for fast growing PDO Gas Directorate (mercury removal project, 20 MMSm3/day Saih Nihada gas plant, 48" pipeline, multiple EM and GT driven compression projects, foundation field bus system)
Human Factor Engineering, manage HEMP process within Gas Team Engineering Department
Project review and concept work, write control narratives, safeguarding memoranda, CSU procedures, technical input into projects.

Team of 5 people, managing larger contractor workforces as required by projects (large team for commissioning Saih Nihada gas plant)
profile_positions.title: Head Operations Support Government Gas

profile_positions.description:
Scope:LNG Upstream Facilities consist of Saih Rawl Central Processing Plant (40 MMSm3/day gas, 150.000 bbl/day stabilised condensate, 40.000 t/year of LPG), Integrated Power Station (combined cycle 2 * 30 MW gasturbines with 2*45 MW Waste Heat Recovery Units), Barik Gas gathering Station (15 MMSm3/day), 350 km of 48" and 100 km of 28" gas export lines, HPHT gas wells, flow- and interfield lines, associated infrastructure, control and communication systems. Total capex budget USD 450 million for the facilities, USD 350 million for the pipelines. Prepared, planned and executed together with EPC contractors a phased commissioning of the above described facilities in line with the overall project plan allowing early and stretched condensate production tagets to be met successfully with all facilities in operation by the end of 1999.During 2000 a dual role was assumed, on one hand following up the exception items (USD 30 million outstanding milestone payments) from the commissioning phase for the LNG UF, on the other hand setting up the operations support team for the gas business in Oman. 
Manage team of ca. 50 O&M personnel, considerable contractor workforce. Interface with Oman LNG which started up at same time.
profile_positions.title: Head of Commissioning LNG Upstream Facilities

profile_positions.description: Responsible for operations/maintenance/technical input into LNG UF design. Recruited and trained operations and maintenance staff to run the facilities. This was achieved by dedicated classroom training. In addition responsible to develop a DCS training simulator running on an fully dynamic plant model used for training and CSU activities. Developed the concurrent operations procedures needed during simultaneous construction & operation of the facilities. Developed OPEX budget structure and prepared first budget for the facilities. Set up maintenance management system and finalize input (routines, planning)
profile_positions.title: Operations Engineer, LNG Upstream Facilities

profile_positions.description: AFPC reorganized in 1996, splitting the gas operations in a gasplant section and a transmission and export section. Responsible to set up a maintenance and production organization for operation and maintenance of the AFPC pipeline network (650 km 18" pipeline, 21 ball valve stations, 9 pressure reduction and metering stations, 2 tie-ins for spill over of gas from the Syrian Petroleum Company). Total gas export transported and delivered to consumers was 300 MMScf/day of gas. Highly critical as stable power generation of the country depended on continuous gas delivery to several power plants with only single fuel capability. Co-ordinate gas availability and supply between suppliers and consumers. Set up the organization in such a way that it is ready, as an independent company, to operate and maintain except the AFPC network also the pipeline grid of the Syrian Petroleum Company which was going to be integrated with the AFPC network. Initial staff 50, which increased to 75 during 1996/1997. Accountable for a budget of U$ 8.000.000, - Other activities bid evaluation and supervision of a pipeline pigging contract for main oil and gas export pipelines (U$ 4.000.000, -), manage critical pipeline repair to major power station.
profile_positions.title: Head of Gas Transmission and Export

profile_positions.description:
The Omar Gasplant processed associated gas to yield specification quality sales gas, LPG for domestic use and stabilized condensate. Gas compressed to 104 barg and exported. Condensate fractionation system to yield LPG and stabilized condensate. LPG storage and road tanker loading station . As Production Section Head responsible for day to day operations of the plant to ensure that production targets are being achieved at the required specifications both in the short and long term minimizing operating cost and product loss.

Accountable for an operating budget of 5.000.000, - U$ and 70 staff. Responsible for manpower planning, evaluation and development of SHELL and especially for Syrian staff. Other activities:

- executed process studies and improved plant performance (hydrate formation and LPG prodcution); 
-coordinated and supervised a major simultaneous inspection/maintenance and engineering shutdown of existing plant and additional brownfield construction work for an extension to increase capacity (200 contractor staff extra on plant) of the plant.
profile_positions.title: Production Section Head, Omar Gasplant
Production Operations Support Engineer.
Senior Field Supervisor

profile_positions.description: Day-to-day operation of 4 sweet and 2 low calorie gasfields and accountable for a total gas production and treatment to specification of 15*10E6 Nm3/day from 60 wells. Operations included 15 satellite plants with high pressure gas, water and condensate separation, 5 triethylene dehydration plants and one cryogenic plant with condensate stabilization system. Accountable for an operating budget of NFI. 2.000.000, - Number of staff 15
profile_positions.title: Field Supervisor, sweet & low calory gasfields.

profile_positions.description: Roving in NAM, mainly offshore and some onshore operations, planning & programming, workover, wireline and well stimulation work. Carried out studies on benzene contents of glycol reboiler still columns overheads on several North Sea offshore gas platforms, maximum allowable annulus pressures for gas wells, preventing oxygen ingress in boiler feedwater for high pressure steam generation oilfield Schoonebeek.
profile_positions.title: Operations Support Supervisor

profile_positions.description:
Non-SHELL part of career. The Koninklijke Nederlandse Papierfabrieken was at the time of employment the largest producer of paper and board in the Netherlands. Working for North Division which produced paper, graphic and coated board for the packaging, corrugated board and book binding industry. The Kappa Britannia mill produced 80.000 ton/year of paper & board on 1 paper and 2 board machines. The mill had an extensive treatment plant to produce pulp from waste paper, a co-generation plant for the generation of electricity for the mill and steam for the paper and board machines. The mill had a state of the art waste water treatment system (aerobic and anaerobic plant).Responsible for quality inspection of the finished product and rejection of product not to specification. Introduced sampling system based on statistical methods to ensure product quality. Maintained contact with customers in case of quality or technology problems. In the mill itself responsible for monitoring all process streams (pulp, paper, steam, water etc.) via statistical methods to maintain process efficiency and of performance of all water treatment plants (demineralization, waste water). Accountable for contact with Dutch authorities for yearly environmental tax payments. Supervised & commissioned installation process computers (NFI. 1.600.000, - project) on both board machines. Budget NFI. 200.000, -, number of staff 8.
Special highlight give training courses at Duch Paper Institute for process operators.
profile_positions.title: Head of Laboratory and Quality Control.

profile_positions.description: Engineering, design and commissioning of several projects:-complete vacuum system for the paper machine (capacity pumps and piping, piping design and construction, water knock out drums, vacuum boxes), NFI. 250.000,- project; - -complete stock flow systems for each paper and board machine, including piping construction, pump capacity design and procurement, process instrumentation and control systems, NFI. 80.000,- per machine;-installation of sensors on all paper and board machines to control water content and thickness of product. Assistant project manager for a NFI. 15.000.000, - project to revamp all paper and board machines, construct new building for board machines, install waste heat recovery systems for board machines, redesign steam systems for board machines and installation of automated transport and packaging system for finished product.
profile_positions.title: Process & project Engineer

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the planning of customer orders on the paper and board machines in the most efficient and economic way. Execute minor project to automate planning process.
profile_positions.title: Production Planning Engineer
